ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned much about letterpress printing and the world of typesetting and printing.
Exposure to an incredible, but forgotten resource that Yale has preserved- the letterpress. This class has helped me learn the techniques of traditional letterpress printing.
this class really opened my eyes to typography and the art of it and it really appreciating. What is the printing process and how to create art.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: learn a lot quickly, engaging, and topics covered in class can extend after completion of class. Weakness: not a lot of time given in-class for major projects (LOTS of out-of-class time expected).
Taught by a wonderful teacher, every student could feel his enthusiasm and passion.

The strength of this course was that it taught me the importance of putting in the hours to fulfill my vision of a project and the brainstorming process, and how important it was to come in with a plan before coming into the press. It also taught me the ability to come back from ideas and learn how to think of different innovative ways to see my idea or creation come to life in the printing press. The only con I would say is that in terms of structure I feel like it was hard to have enough time to do the final book project, and the essay in the mist of finals week , but yet again, I do not acknowledge that typography and printing is a lengthy process.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Most definitely. It is SO much work, but it is so worth it.

I would highly recommend this course to anybody willing to push further than they have, and commit hours to a new art they may have never tried before. For me, this experience has showed me the value of typography and has encouraged me to try new things outside my comfort zone.

extras.title: ART 006 01 - Art of the Printed Word
